intro: Agrostophyllum montis-jayanum, commonly known as the Jayanum mountain grass, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white to pale green flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to withstand cold and high-altitude conditions. Agrostophyllum montis-jayanum is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
